subject: Science
title: Groups and Periods
description: A micro-lesson that makes Groups and Periods usable.

hook.text: The periodic table isn't a random grid. Every row and column tells you something specific.

buildup.text: Rows are called periods. Each period adds a new electron shell.

discovery.text: Columns are called groups. Elements in the same group share similar chemical behavior.

punchline.text: Same column, same personality. The periodic table is a personality chart for elements.

quiz.question: Why do elements in the same group behave similarly?
options: They have the same number of outer electrons
They have the same atomic weight
They were discovered in the same era
